dialogues.text: Trevor flounders through a disoriented flurry of bubbles. swims up to the passenger door and tries the handle. It w give. Unable to breathe Trevor finally swims up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks the surface and crawls onto the shore... He looks out at the car to where she should be trapped inside...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trevors eyes are wide with desperation, breath quickening The car is sinking fast... He looks at the car and calls out, but there is no Kristy insight. The car disappears under the surface... Trevor hears something from above and looks up. A chunk o the bashed-up guardrail is sailing right down toward him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gooding? You still in there? Trevor blinks and looks around him. Lange is sitting just where they were when he saw him last. Only now there's a wary look on his face. Whoa. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh. Yes detective, sorry. Just trying to recollect, you know? Lange nods. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. From what I remember now, maybe my wife was thrown from the car when it hit the water. Maybe she wasn't trapped inside. Lange checks the report again. He believes Trevor...or do he? LANGE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a start. I'll tell the people trawling the river maybe it makes a difference maybe not. Thanks for your help Trevor. If we have any more questions you'll get a call from myself or my partner Detective Givens. Lange stands up and backs up awkwardly to a file behind h desk. Trevor stares at him suspiciously. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys know something I don't?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All things considered we probably know a lot less than you do. Have a good afternoon, Mr. Gooding. Trevor exits, both men maintain eye contact as the door closes between him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls up to the curb. Trevor climbs out and start walking down the empty street. As soon as the bus pulls a the only sound heard is Trevor's footsteps. POV BEHIND TREVOR: We see Trevor's back from a slight distance. Someone is following him. Sensing this, Trevor looks behind him. Nothing but an emp sidewalk. Trevor hurries his pace, almost there at his apartment building. He glances behind him again. Nope, no there... then suddenly- -A DARK FIGURE passes under a streetlight on the opposite side of the street. Trevor turns a corner no picking up t pace a little. The DARK FIGURE follows, it picks up it's as well. Trevors walks an d approaches a small alley way. Should h take this home? A enraged Pitbull nearly rips his nose off as it Barks an lunges to the end of a heavy chain leash. Trevor (and us) about piss our pant's. The dog continues barking, Trevor regains his composure. Suddenly the dogs attention moves toward the direction of the DARK FIGURE. Amazingly, it st barking and actually cowers back into the shadows. Spooked, Trevor rushes up to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries up to his apartment building and lets himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out on the street. The figure is walking up the building opposite his. It's features are shrouded in shadow, but it is definitely sta at Trevor, who slams the apartment door behind him. He pe out at the street from inside the front hall. The figure is gone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trevors looks around the apartment. He opens the fridge, lights up the darkened room. He grabs one of the three it sitting on the wire racks. About to twist off the cap off cold beer, when a light out his window urges him to investigate. He draws the curtain open and GASPS. POV OUT WINDOW: Staring back at him, from a dimly lit win in the apartment building across the street, is the SHADO MAN that followed Trevor home. The man's face is shrouded in shadows but Trevor can see holding something bundled up in a blanket. The light in t window winks out, rendering it dark again. Trevor can almost still see the figure somewhere in the darkness still gazing at him. Trevor looks a little sick all of a sudden, like he can't breathe. THE BELL FROM A DISTANT CATHEDRAL begins to peel. BONG... BONG... BONG... Trevor opens his mouth to draw in a breath but instead sp out a massive amount of water! BONG... BONG... BONG... Trevor falls to the ground, arms and legs thrashing, heav up mouthfuls of water. Trevor is drowning... BONG... BONG... BONG... In the puddles of water, we see bits of debris: leaves, pebbles, etc. Finally, a hideous eel-like creature's head pokes out of Trevor's gaping mouth- it escapes and slithe across the floor, up the window sill and out into the nig -the ringing bell stops abruptly and he takes in a humong lungful of sweet oxygen. He then notices he is completely dry. Stunned, he looks about him. Trevor is now laying on the easychair, nursing a beer. Hi videogame is flashing PLAY AGAIN? Whoa. The BING-BONG! of his doorbell startles him. Trevor gets the door to find a striking young GOTHIC WOMA the other side. Black hair, lipstick, fingernails. She sm (too brightly for someone with such somber appointments) summarily lifts her shirt to just below her breasts for Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GOTHIC WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is, what do you think? Trevor looks down at her stomach, the lower half of which contains tattoos which just break the surface of her jean At its center is a navel pierced with a studded black pea which Gothic Woman then plays with. Trevor looks a little confused. GOTHIC WOMAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it on the counter, looked at the name and the rest is history. It's like, named after me. Well...? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting uncomfortable) Oh. Uh... it's beautiful. I'm sorry, I've just been having a weird day... TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I totally understand. Listen I don't know if you're into incense but, I bought some, it's called Witching Hour. To inhale it is to love it. I mean the stuff'll clear your head big time. Come on over, I'll burn some for you. If you can't sleep tonight... She jabs a thumb down the hall behind her. TAWNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... knock on my door, I'm a total insomniac. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks I've got a... a date tonight- His eyes roaming her, he finally finds a tattoo on her shoulder reading: TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Tawny. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyebrows raised) Whew. You bounce right back don't you? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't your like... whole life get totalled last week?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week... TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car accident? Any of this ringing a bell? Trevor eyes her nervously then: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that kind of date. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey even if it is more power to ya. (awkwardly) Alrighty then. Have a good time. Tawny ambles off to her apartment. Trevor closes the door leans against it. He slides down the door and covers his with his hands. Another headache coming on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor paces in his living room. Looks at watch. Then the door. Still no sign of Gwen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor rummages through a closet. Reaching up to a shelf above him, he tugs at a big cardboard box and pulls. The entire box comes crashing down and out spill about fifty tapes, all hand-labeled: KIRSTY & TREVOR, then the da He puts one in the VCR, hits play... It's his wedding video. Trevor watches the festivity of t wedding ON THE SCREEN, he smiles for the first time. The wedding portion of the tape ends and a not-so-clean e takes us into the honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor holds the camera on Kristy who is under the covers a generic hotel room. She looks into camera as Trevor adj focus and squares up the frame. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Trevor. It's been one year. Three hundred sixty five days.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR (OFF CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight thousand seven hundred sixty hours. Five hundred twenty five thousand... Kirsty watches Trevor roam the room. She very comfortable camera. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does feel to be Mr. Kirsty Hughes for a whole year. TREVOR (OFF CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a word? Lucrative. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best business decision if you ever made I'll bet. TREVOR (OFF CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoyable too. The merger never even felt work for one second. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what the family lawyer told me one our wedding day? TREVOR (OFF CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never to put you in my will. TREVOR (OFF CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Why? KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you'd be staying with me for me and not because you'd get rich if I died for some reason. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you had more wisdom than to listen to a false prophet KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no wisdom, no insight, no plan (prvb 21:30) They share a moment.    Kristy stares at him quietly thro the camera.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KIRSTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And besides, I thought, to hell with it... it's okay if you only married me for my money. TREVOR (OFF CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, why's that? KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only married you for your body. They laugh. The camera now looks away from Kristy and int Trevors suitcase. Trevors pulls out a wrapped present. A small tightly wrappped, perfectly square gift. KIRSTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? The camera now back on Kristy. And the present comes up i frame. TREVOR (OFF CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Anniversary, Mrs. Gooding. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me? Trevor! How romantic! Come here, you. The camera begins to wobble as Trevor climbs onto the bed Its lands sideways, and we see sheets and covers rustling accompanied by the sound of giggling and kissing. The tape ends. SNOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM THE COUCH Trevor watches this...Any of this ringing bell?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Trevor gets up and pops the tape out.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: He slowly walks toward the door. He opens it to find a pi dark hallway. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Who's out there? GWEN suddenly comes out of the darkness clamping her mout onto his and examining his tonsils with her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late dear. Trevor looks like he'd be more turned on sitting bare-ass on an autopsy table. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen you scared the living shit out of me. She pushes him toward the chair and sits him in it. GWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are turning into an old fuddy duddy. Shoe. Gwen puts one foot on his chest. GWEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on don't make me beat you. Trevor pulls the shoe off. GWEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other shoe. Trevor does the same for the other leg. GWEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy. (looking around) Where's is it? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? GWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our little toy. You usually have it up and running by now. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I really want to know what you're talking about?

dialogues.speaker: EASY CHAIR.
dialogues.text: The cable from the camera runs all the way to the TV wher SEE what's happening as well.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's intense. Gwen is on top. Gwen aggressively pulls Trevor's shirt off then goes for his belt. Trevor suddenl grabs her hands. GWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Gwen. I just can't. Gwen climbs off the chair and throws her jacket back on. GWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have definitely got a screw loose, Trevor. Goodbye. Stuffing her feet in her shoes, Gwen's out the door. Trevor SIGHS, relieved the attack is finally over. About to turn the TV off and stow away his camera. He loo at the TV and freezes. THE IMAGE ON THE TV shows that Gwen is still there, undressing Trevor. Only video Trevor is giving in, kissin her back, pulling her clothes off. Trevor looks at the camera. The red "record" light is flashing. Trevor turns back to the TV walking closer and closer to the screen. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? He waves a hand in front of the camera and his hand actua appears on the TV in front of the sex image.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR WATCHES
dialogues.text: Trevor and Gwen make love in video. Video Trevor turns to the camera (to Trevor) and gives a menacing smile. Video Trevor looks back up at Gwen, who smiles down at hi carnivorously. She licks her lips. VIDEO GWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one thing I should have told you right from the beginning Trevor. Video Trevor doesn't see a knife she manages to slip out her purse.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VIDEO GWEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it pretty rough. To Trevor's shock Gwen suddenly drags the knife right acr his throat. Blood shoots up at Gwen's grinning face. Bloo pours out of Trevor's mouth and down his chest. FROM THE COLOR SCREEN Trevor, having just seen himself ge murdered, shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Allison stands above him Bic razor in her gloved hand. Th bottom half of Trevor's face is covered with shaving crea ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I thought you were going to stay under longer. His face is clean shaven, a little shaving cream remains around his chin. He now has several electrodes attached t his cranium. They're connected to an EEG which BEEPS LOUD The noise bothers Trevor. His eyes dart this way and that focuses on the Bic razor. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening to me? What are you doing? ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came in for your EEG. You fell asleep and well, I took the liberty of...I'm sorry. You looked like a wreck Trevor. Trevor seems to like the attention. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just had the most vivid dream. I was sure I was dying. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can relax now you are quite alive. And as long as you're awake, chin up. Trevor puts his chin up and Allison continues shaving his neck. Trevor studies her face.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALLISON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? What do you say Trevor? Que pasa? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggily) Let me see. Oh yeah. My head feels like it's going through a meat grinder. I'm not sure if I'm dreaming or... ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interupting) That `poor me' attitude doesn't suit you Trevor. Listen, I don't mean to sound like Pollyanna but things could be worse. There's one good thing about coming so near to the end of ones life. Everything is new and exciting, like your seeing it for the first time. You might see things a litlle differently from now on. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your insight is enlightening. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wisdom, no insight, no plan. Allison gives him a wink, disarming Trevor. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife said that exact same sentence to me the day we got married. She even winked too. Allison smiles and puts her hand on his. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you use this wife thing to hit on all the interns? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) No... just you. Allison wipes his face clean with a towel. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Just like a baby's butt. Allison gets up, grabs a clipboard starts filling out a report. Trevor stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison? Why can't remember what happened to my wife? Is it something I'm on that's... that's making me forget? ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy there Trevor. You need to relax. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I need to remember. Look whatever it is take me off it. I can handle pain. I can't handle not knowing... ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get better first Trevor. Way better. (scribbling in the chart) It's okay to miss somebody. It's okay to still love someone after they're gone. But you've got to quit blaming yourself okay...? Okay? Allison looks up and notices Trevor's body has slackened, eyes empty. She drops the clipboard and starts snapping h fingers over his eyes. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor? He is unconscious. A LOUD STEADY BUZZ sounds from one of machines behind her as blood begins to leak out of Trevor ear. Allison jumps up and hits call button above Trevor's bed. ALLISON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: CODE BLUE
dialogues.text: She yanks Trevor's johnnie down, wheels a defribulator ov to his dying body and grabs the paddles. ALLISON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay Trevor I'm coming for you. Allison rubs the paddles together, presses the paddles against Trevor's chest and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Trevor sits bolt upright in his bed. His alarm clock is making that same BUZZING noise.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trevor is completely disoriented. He sees a note laying n to him on the bed. It says Г¬You're an animal baby... you who...Г® He finally looks at the clock. Seven forty five. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I'm gonna be late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor is on his computer typing madly. ON THE SCREEN WE he has accessed the local newspaper. He calls up an artic reading: ACCIDENT LEAVES ONE HOSPITALIZED ANOTHER MISSING He looks at a newspaper picture of the bridge, which is humming with rescue activity. Trevor's head is pounding. He goes into his desk drawer a pulls out a bottle of aspirin. Trevor empties the last of the bottle's six tablets into hand, downs them, chases them with what's left of an econ sized bottle of Mylanta. Trevor can't seem to even look a his computer screen. He hears a DING-DING and looks up. He has an instant office message waiting. Trevor clicks O The instant message reads: Г¬IT'S TOO LATE.Г® Trevor rapi types up. Г¬WHO IS THIS.Г® The same message is repeated.

dialogues.speaker: TOO LATE. IT'S TOO LATE. IT'S TOO LATE.
dialogues.text: Trevor stands up and looks around mazelike structure of cubicles as far as he can see. All of his co-workers are slaving away on their keypads. Trevor sits back down and cancels the instant message. He ruminates for a moment. From behind Bret's fingers TAPPING on the keyboard seem t get louder, more frustrated. They finally stop and Bret stretches momentarily. BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be nice. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting paid for doing shit. Bret goes back to work again, fingers HAMMERING away. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bret.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously man, you oughta work for the government. You've got the sense of urgency for it. Trevor himself begins to type, slowly, reluctantly. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm doing my best considering okay? BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey if the boss doesn't notice who cares right? Just slack all the live long day if you want. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boss won't notice me doing a bad job because I'm not. Even if the boss thought I was slacking I'd know right away. BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how's that? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smug) I have my connections BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Do tell. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Gwen. Bret freezes. He then looks at Trevor, eyes bulging. BRET

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I crap you not. She was all over me yesterday in the break room. And she was a total machine last night too. BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were supposed to have a date with Gwen last night? GWEN DEARDON? The supervisor? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious as a heart attack my friend. I think she literally fucked me brains out.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (super sarcastic) Wow that's quite a feat Trevor congratulations. Must be really tough to get your brains fucked out by a CORPSE. Trevor stops and looks at Bret. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? This is your sick joke man. Gwen was murdered here six months ago. The security guard found her all over her office. Her head was in the waste paper basket. Her stomach was in the filing cabinet. Her ass was on the copy machine... Trevor is speechless. BRET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never found the sicko who did it... remember? Trevor still can't speak. He goes into his computer mailb and re-opens the file he'd received from Г¬You Know Who.Г He stifles a scream when he sees the jpegs have changed. they're still of Gwen. Pieces of her swimming in puddles her own blood. Where it once said Г¬Work harderГ® it now Г¬Police File.Г® TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Jesus Christ... Trevor looks behind him to make sure Bret hasn't seen any this. He's facing his own computer typing away. BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man are you ever out of the loop. Either that or you've got the worst sense of humor this side of Jeffrey Dahmer. What is your problem anyway? Trevor quickly deletes the entire file. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly Bret? I think I lost my mind. And now I'm finding pieces of it, like pieces of a wrecked car, scattered on the side of the road. A beat. BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud you need to decompress. I told you you came back to work too soon after the accident. Trevor says nothing. BRET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you know what Trev? I'm going to hook you up man. Here... Bret wheels across the cubicle on his chair and hands something to Trevor. It's an oddly designed postcard bear some sort of voodoo mask. The font is faux-Oriental, the they use for Chinese take-out menus. He looks closer. It' appointment card for an acupuncturist. Sage. BRET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This woman will take one look at you and know exactly what you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chart of all the puncture points on the human body is tacked to the wall. Trevor lies on the table. SAGE, a gorgeous ethereal India woman is at the far end, hovering over the soles of his f sticking pins into the appropriate places. She looks up a him slyly. SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These headaches you've been getting. Do they happen in conjunction with the hallucinations? Sage walks over to one of the cabinets, gathering more acupuncture needles. Trevor can't help but notice her sha body, her feline gait. Sage throws a sultry glance over h shoulder at him, prompting him to finally answer her question. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure of himself) Yes, sort of. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head's been in constant pain since the... accident. And the pain increases whenever I, uh... slip into another, I don't know what to call them... Sage comes back to him, several needles in one hand. She looks into his eyes. SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dreams? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to say dimensions. But I guess technically they are dreams. SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should always listen to your subconscious. It's trying to tell you something about your waking life. Sage begins applying the needles fluidly to his upper bod now. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I never feel like I'm sleeping. It's sort of, waking narcolepsy. I'll be somewhere and then- (snapping his fingers) -it's like I was never wherever I was to begin with I was really somewhere else entirely. Sage puts the last needle in. For the first time Trevor actually feels a releief of pressure in his head. TREVOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, whatever that was...do it again. That just set me free of the worlds longest head ache. Is this making any sense? SAGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None whatsoever. Now just relax. Let the needles do the driving. A PHONE OUTSIDE THE OFFICE RINGS. Sage looks up at the do SAGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting his cheek) Don't go anywhere. I'll be right back. Trevor watches Sage EXIT the office. He lies there a mome bathing in warm sunshine. He is relaxed, pain free.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Behind him, an acupuncture anatomy chart on the wall. Whi begins to change its shape. It morphs (or economically changes) into PINHEAD. Trevor is oblivious as PINHEAD approaches, doll eyes betraying no feeling whatsoever. Then, Pinhead reaches up his head and begins pulling out one of those infamous pin It takes a while to come out. Because it is a foot long. Once out, the needle drips wit black ooze. Trevor hears a noise and believes its Sage who's reentere the room. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking this might just be what I needed. Pinhead speaks but in Sages voice. As he pushes on of the pins into the tip Trevors skin in his back . PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what happens just remember... Before Trevor can react, Pinhead suddenly jabs the pin do into Trevor's back, pinning him to the table! It sears hi skin. In Pinheads recognizable voice... PINHEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all here for you Trevor. As Trevor reels in terror, Pinhead pulls another foot lon needle from his head and thrusts this one into his neck! SEE the needle come right out the other side, nailing its into the table. Trevor can't believe he's still alive! Pinhead pulls one more out, aims this one at Trevor's arm and swings down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison pokes Trevor's arm with a hypodermic. She places reassuring hand on his chest. Machines behind her are PIN and BUZZING like crazy. Allison looks a little worried. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. It's okay. Go back to sleep. Allison blurs out of focus...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ... then briefly comes back into focus... ... only now it's A MAN INSIDE A DARKENED ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TREVOR'S POV: Buried in the murky shadow, all that can be seen are his hands, lit by a shaft of sunlight beaming through a blinded window. A ring on the man's left pinky finger glimmers eerily, almost too much. We saw this man an earlier FLASHBACK He's holding something. The cube. He speaks in an ECHOED DISTORTED VOICE. DARKENED MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Divorce isn't good enough. Abandonment isn't good enough. There's only one way to do it and do it cleanly, without leaving a trace of evidence. The darkened man pushes the cube across the desk towards DARKENED MAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open this and your problem will disappear forever. And no one will ever suspect you. A word of caution though. A certain side effect of the box. Pleasure. Pleasures that would redefine the parameters of sensation. Trevors picks up the cube. DARKENED MAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the cube is opened there is no turning back. Ever. A LOUD BUZZING NOISE BEGINS drowning out the darkened man words as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor quietly wakes up to the sound of his alarm BUZZING again. He stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor pushes through the front doors and a RECEPTIONIST greets him with a big smile and a business card.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afternoon doll-face. Hey, a police detective was just here to see you. (looking at the card) Some guy named Givens. She hands the card to him batting her eyelashes. Trevor l at the card as she checks out his package. Trevor reads t word HOMICIDE. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh thanks this looks a little important. Could you let the folks upstairs know I'll be late? RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you bubbalicious? (winking) I'd lay across a bed of nails. Trevor walks back OUT and the receptionist watches him go Another female employee walks by staring at Trevor. She l at the receptionist and they both nod in agreement. RECEPTIONIST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it girl. That ass is a three- hummer baby. Mmm-mmm-mmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same office only Trevor is sitting at the other desk acro from a hawklike MAN who is playing with a yoyo. This is GIVENS. If good cop bad cop is the scheme here, he's the latter. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I still... I don't understand how this is a homicide case. I mean nobody was murdered here... Her body's been missing for I don't know how long now and... GIVENS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you just say? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said she's been missing for- GIVENS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No you said HER BODY's been missing. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GIVENS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time anybody saw this woman she was alive. You seem to certain she's dead. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearing up) I saw her drowning inside the car, detective. GIVENS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read up on you, man. You're a smart guy aren't you? I mean with numbers. Right? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say that. GIVENS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero's a number right? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in one minus one equals zero yes. Where are you going with this? GIVENS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many zeros was your wife worth? Brow furrowing, Trevor stands up. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to my attorney. Now. Givens pushes his phone toward Trevor, who takes it and d furiously. Givens remains poker-faced. Trevor dials a num TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes I need LARRY ELLIS' office please. He says the lawyer's name like it's supposed to intimidat Givens. He couldn't care less. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Yeah this is Trevor Gooding I need to speak with Larry... Trevor...? Kirsty Gooding's husband...? (another beat) I see do you know when he'll be out that meeting? Fine I'll uh... call back then... Okay you give him the message and he'll call me that's great.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With that Trevor hangs up the phone and EXITS the office. Givens BUSTS OUT LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor types bitterly on the computer crunching numbers l a madman. BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what pissed you off but it's nice to see you getting the job done for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor plays his videogame with venom. The cries of his k emanate from the TV, building to a crescendo. Finally we a WOMAN'S VOICE come from the TV. WOMAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: I'M SAVED
dialogues.text: Trevor flicks the REPLAY button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor stares at the self-taken picture of him and his wi mugging at the camera. What is it that Kirsty is holding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV is on. Trevor flips through the channels. He stops the Nature Channel. A goat is casually munching on some n and berries. ANNNOUNCER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from TV) -at the dawning of the agrarian age goat's milk would be considered a suitable substitute for a mother's breast milk. And the sacrifice of a goat would appease an angry god and ensure a bountiful harvest. But in time the ritual would become associated with less hallowed purposes.

dialogues.speaker: HEADLINE
dialogues.text: ANNNOUNCER'S VOICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goat's blood is said to hold supernatural properties linked to black magic. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANNNOUNCER'S VOICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In conjunction with the pentangle- the five pointed star- the spilling of goat's blood is considered to be either an aphrodisiac that can be used in demonic orgies, or a means by which a high priest may summon Satan himself. AN ILLUSTRATION of a goat with many eyes appears on the screen. ANNNOUNCER'S VOICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from TV) The Book of Revelations speaks of the anti-Christ as the beast with many eyes. For centuries illustrators have chosen a goat to represent this beast. His eyes hurting too much to watch any more, Trevor turns TV off. Out of sheer instinct he suddenly turns to look-

dialogues.speaker: -OUT HIS WINDOW
dialogues.text: The apartment across the street is lit. A STRANGE FIGURE standing in the window. Trevor jumps up and rushes over to his window. He looks O at that same shadowy man he saw earlier. The man's face i still obscured and is still holding something in a blanke Squinting Trevor is able to make out what it is: A SLEEPING BABY. The stranger pulls the baby's blanket ov the baby's angelic face. Then the light in that apartment goes out abruptly. Trevor stares at the darkened window breathing heavily. I the stranger still in there, watching Trevor in the dark? Trevor cannot tell. A SUDDEN KNOCKING AT THE DOOR makes him flinch. Trevor goes to the door, opens it to find: TAWNY. Only now she's dressed in a skintight black rubber dress. She smiles accentuating a fresh coat of black lipstick. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Can I borrow something? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... sure, Tawny... what? TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tawny grabs the back of his neck, pulling him to her as s kisses him deeply. She grabs his collar and pulls him out the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around, leading Trevor through the hall like a horse. A very confused horse. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tawny? What's- what are you doing? TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: YOU
dialogues.text: Trevor eyes her gorgeous body and decides not to resist q so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor leans against the counter, sipping at a glass of w nervously. Right next to him, Tawny's at the stove, stirr a pot of something dark and bubbly. She looks up at him, smiling seductively. But Trevor's still a few lengths beh TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm, uh, not sure... Feeling kind of weird actually. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Tawny grabs Trevor's balls and he jumps away as if jolted a cattle-prod. TAWNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kinda feeling nuts myself! TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never said this to a woman before but can't we talk a little bit before grabbing at each other? TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) God. Sometimes you can be such an animal. Other times you are the ultimate tease... She holds up a spoonful of what she's been stirring. It l like stew.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TAWNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taste this. Keeping a hand below his waist Trevor leans toward the sp tastes, licks his lips. Then squints. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That's good. Lots of capers, huh? TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters. It's also got fennel, asparagus, olives, some more of mother nature's aphrodisiacs... Back in college, me and my roommates used to call it hard- on stew. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a very appetizing name. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have some more. Trevor takes another sip of it. TAWNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever smelled this coming from our dorm room, you knew one of us was in there getting laid. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have been very proud of yourselves... TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting hot in here. Tawny summarily unzips her rubber dress and whips it off. Trevor is speechless. Tawny's body is covered with bites and bruises. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... who did that to you? Tawny BUSTS OUT LAUGHING. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding right? Trevor shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TAWNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did! God, you are funny tonight. Tawny approaches Trevor who tenses up. TAWNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost like I'm with somebody else. Trevor starts looking very ill. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tawny I think I'm going to be sick. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now there's a compliment. Trevor grabs his stomach, lurching over. He can't breath. Trevor looks up at Tawny. But it is no longer her. Tawny changed into something else entirely. A CENOBITE. The Cenobite rips Trevor's shirt open, and we can see movement within his abdomen. Like a baby kicking. Whateve in their shoots up expanding Trevor's chest cavity. The Cenobite pins Trevor to the wall and hovers in his fa as if about to kiss him. Before Trevor can scream he is choking. The Cenobite watc with glee as something begins to move up into Trevor's throat, expanding his neck, forcing his jaws open and finally... ... a BLACK EEL pokes its head out of Trevor's mouth. The Cenobite opens its own mouth and the eel starts to crawl inside it. Meanwhile Trevor's about to pass out from asphyxiation when-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -he takes a deep grateful breath through an oxygen mask. various pieces of monitoring equipment around him are BEE and PINGING like slot machines. Allison walks around the room pressing buttons that silen each machine one by one, then walks up to the bed, lookin surprisingly calm. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. There was a blockage in your oxygen hose. Won't happen again, promise.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trevor looks relieved. Shell-shocked but relieved. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm certainly keeping you busy huh? ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Too bad I hate my job... She strokes his forehead. ALLISON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling better now? Trevor shakes his head. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These hallucinations I'm having. I think they're more like memories coming back to me in a strange way. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's not necessarily a bad thing is it? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they're blocked memories... I'm starting to realize the reason why I blocked them out. Allison I think I really... screwed everything up. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. Don't blame yourself Trevor. Please. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss her. I miss my wife. Trevor takes her hand. Allison looks briefly around her then... climbs onto the bed with him. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need to cry, go ahead. I won't tell. Holding her hand to his face, Trevor closes his eyes, squeezing out a tear. CLOSE ON TREVOR'S FACE. WE start to NOTICE subtle differe about Allison's hand. It is very pale, the fingernails bl Trevor opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is now lying on Tawny's bed, which is surrounded by un candles. Sunlight streams through her open window. It is hand he is holding to his face. The rest of her is sittin under the sheet, covered head propped against the headboa Trevor drops her hand and it falls lifelessly to the bed beside him. Breathing quickening he reaches up to the bla silk sheet covering her head. He yanks it back and covers mouth in horror. She's been bound to the bed and gagged with a white cloth that is soaked with blood. A deep vertical incision has b made in her neck, collarbone to chin and her tongue is pu through the wound so it sticks out the bottom of her jaw. that's just for starters. When Trevor looks down he gags when he sees her ribcage h been opened like a set of French doors and her insides sitting in her lap. The coup de grace? Trevor now sees he is covered with blo HERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor splashes his face with cold water, trying to get h composure back. He stares at the water rushing down the d for a moment. His breathing stabilizes He finally looks u his reflection in the mirror... ... to see PINHEAD staring back at him. Trevor jolts backward in shock and does a double take. It him now, looking completely unhinged. Outside the PHONE RINGS. The answering machine picks up w a BEEP. LANGE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from answering machine) This is Lange. We need to talk as soon as possible. It's about your little... dilemma. Give me a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleaned up now Trevor carefully makes his way back to Taw apartment. He tries the door. It's locked. This can't be right. He jiggles the door knob violently, then finally K the door.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly- -TAWNY answers the door, looking utterly pissed off. Thou still in Goth mode, she's dressed much more conservativel now. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tawny... I- you're- Trevor goes to embrace her. She shrinks back, startled. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, I have serious space issues, dude. What do you want? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... think we need to talk, there's something really strange going on... TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look of recognition) Hey you're the guy from down the hall. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, quit fucking around. Listen it's about... what we did together last night. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (utterly shocked)

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: A VERY DEEP VOICE comes from somewhere behind her. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is that? TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that guy from down the hall. He thinks we did something with him last night. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's- who's in there with you...? Tawny looks aghast. TAWNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you cracking up or something?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly an enormous BRUTE of a MAN, wide as he is tall ENTERS the doorway. He's wearing a black tee, black jeans and, Trevor can't help notice, black nail polish... on fingers and toes. Obviously Tawny's significant other. BRUTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can we do for you, chief? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... who are you? Brute takes a sideward step through the doorway, forcing Trevor back two steps. BRUTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Tawny, you better know me, pal. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I don't want any trouble. I was mistaken... I'll see you later. BRUTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much. Trevor turns and hurries off. Brute turns to Tawny who sh and makes a twirly motion at her temple. The two go back her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor paces in his apartment telephone to his ear. He le out a heavy breath and looks at his watch. Finally: OPERATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: City police main switchboard how may I direct your call? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already asked me that ten minutes ago just before you put me on hold. I'm looking for defective- I mean Detective Lange. OPERATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh he and his partner just stepped out to lunch, can I-? Trevor hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor sits at the front of the bus agitated. He folds an unfolds Detective Lange's business card in his hands like some frustrated Origami artist. The SIREN from a passing ambulance drills his ears. The irritating sound eventually fades away but the pain in hi head is still there. The BONGING of a distant cathedral's bell makes him pause looks around. Toward the rear and sees a familiar old lady knitting a baby's bootie. He looks again. The bootie is bright red a dripping... blood? Trevor follows the strand of bright re wool down to their source: A DYING GOAT laying under the seat. It's insides have bee ripped out. Its veins and tendons are serving as the old lady's yarn. Trevor's eyes bolt back up to the old woman. She continue HUMMING sweetly, her lap speckled with goat's blood. Trev pulls the wire and an OBNOXIOUS BUZZING goes off. Trevor hurries up to the bus driver as the bus pulls over. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just open the doors I'll jump off. BUS DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not while the bus is moving, sir. Trevor clutches his head in pain and waits for the bus to stop. The doors open. He jumps off, knees nearly buckling from the pain. He looks up as the bus speeds off. IN THE REAR WINDOW the little black girl seen earlier pop up. She's holding her little doll. She pushes a clothespi into its head. Blood drips from the puncture. At the same time Trevor feels an incredible pain sear through his hea He squints at the bus again. The little girl is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lange is at his desk eating a sandwich. Trevor comes in angrier than a hornet in a beehive. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my wife Detective Lange? What the hell did you do with her?!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gooding I assure you we are doing everything within our- TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you leave me that message? LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. Trevor SLAMS his hand down on Lange's desk and gets right his face. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: LIAR
dialogues.text: Trevor immediately turns around and walks OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LARRY ELLIS is a somber but handsome young attorney. At present he at his desk poring through several books on ch custody law. He makes notes on a pad beside him as he tal LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Basically they know where your wife's body is and they're not telling you as a tactic to get you to confess? Yet neither of them has come out and told you that you're a suspect. Is that what you're trying to say? Trevor sits on the other side of the humongous office in chair so big it practically swallows him whole. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Larry I know you never thought too much of me. And I know this all sounds a little fucked up. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little? Try unbelievably. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear these guys are like playing mindgames with me. I think they got a hold of my e-mail address at work too. Larry is not buying this for a nanosecond. He trims some brown leaves off a small plant as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor barring the more outrageous aspects of your claim you are not the only widower the police have questioned when foul play is suspected. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey ninety five point three percent of all murders are committed by either a spouse, a direct relative or a close friend that's common knowledge. But this wasn't murder it was an accident- LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concentrating on his notes) And as far as hiding a body goes? I find it hard to believe even the dirtiest of cops would keep a victim's remains hidden simply to get someone to confess. It's absolutely preposterous. Now I'm not saying I don't believe you, I'm....ambiguous. There's quite alot of money behind all this. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do I stand to inherit if Kirsty is presumed dead? Larry sighs and walks over to his desk. He presses a butt on his intercom. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie can you bring in the Gooding papers? ASSISTANT'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from intercom) Right away Mr. Ellis. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh. Ballpark would be fine Larry. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the vicinity of eight million four hundred fifty thousand. Or is it sixty- TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens if I'm convicted of Kirsty's murder? LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well they'd have to prove it in a court of law for one thing-

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Larry. Pretend you like me and humor me. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing you were her sole benefactor, and I'm the executive of the will, Kirsty's entire estate would have to be donated to the city. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? City? Cops? It's a fucking conspiracy! LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon my glibness Trevor but you sound like a raving lunatic. The next time you seek counsel it should be of the psychiatric type. You're obviously on the verge of some nervous collapse. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your concern Larry. And fuck you too. Trevor gets up and heads for the door. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Trevor's back) I never thought your late wife was the sharpest knife in the drawer. But marrying you was the dumbest thing she ever did! On his way out Trevor nearly runs down Larry's ASSISTANT was just coming IN with a large file. Trevor's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor looks despondently out the window. The cab stops a Trevor hands some money to the CABBIE up front. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go. I'm going to be here a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor gets out of the cab, which drives off leaving him the bridge looking down at the water below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police tape FLAPS between the trees. Other than that ther no sign of an investigation. Trevor walks out of the wood the shore, through the police tape and to the water's edg He begins to walk the shore looking out at the still wate He scans the area where the water meets the land, trying remember. Something on the surface few feet away catches his eye. I a rock sticking up. No it's something else. Trevor walks right up to the water and puts his feet on a couple of la rocks breaking the surface. He bends down and looks at... THE CORNER OF A BLACK CUBE. He quickly reaches down, trie pick it up. It seems to be stuck just below the surface. Trevor pulls harder and finally it gives. Trevor slowly l the black cube out of the water and GASPS when he sees-

dialogues.speaker: -A WHITE WATERLOGGED HAND CLUTCHING IT FROM BELOW
dialogues.text: Trevor GASPS and lets go. And just as the cube (along wit its owner) SPLASH under the surface- -ANOTHER WHITE HAND breaks the surface grabbing Trevor's wrist! As Trevor Struggles he looks up to see the dark figure standing above him holding a rock over his head. Just as swings down towards Trevors head-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor jumps scaring the hell out of Allison who has just gotten done taking his pulse. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus I wish you would stop doing that. Trevor looks down at himself. He's on an examination tabl his normal clothes not a hospital johnnie. That's a good sign. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison... Trevor tries to put his thoughts together.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Trevor? What have you got to say for yourself? Que pasa? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice quivering) Allison we have GOT to talk about this medication you've got me on. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all over it. Allison shines a penlight in his eye. ALLISON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blink. Trevor blinks. Satisfied, Allison sits on the bed next to Trevor and takes his hand. ALLISON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. What we're going to do is up the Topomax to two per day instead of one, see if that takes care of these hallucinatory seizures you've been having. The extra Topomax won't interfere with the painkillers either but... You're going to be thrilled to hear this part but we have been told by some patients it affects the memory somewhat... TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weary) Really? Does it affect the memory? Allison looks concerned. Then her features soften. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one tough cookie, Trevor Gooding. You keep coming back to your corner for a quick fix up then go right back out into the ring for another round. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some call it resilience. Others, stupidity. Allison lets a lapse in the conversation last too long. T look of concern returns as she lingers on his face. She's trying to say something. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay Allison?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised at her own emotional outflow) Of course, yes. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way you just looked at me... ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, my bedside manner's horrendous. Allison finishes writing a few notes, and Trevors rolls d his sleves. He's intrigued. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'm done. Thats it for today? ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All finished. Neither of them want this visit to be over. TREVOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bout some lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two share the end of an empty cafeteria table, eating pastel colored trays. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it. In the entire world where's the most life-threatening place you could possibly be at any given moment. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Beirut? New Orleans? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hint. It's not a geographical location. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm stumped. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's inside a moving car. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bull...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got numbers to back me up. Over the course of one year more Americans die in car accidents than did during the entire span of World War II. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay so... what's the safest place? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Statistically speaking? Inside a moving bus. Allison LAUGHS. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millions of people around the world get on busses every day. When was the last time you heard of anybody anywhere dying on a public transit bus? ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Mr. Statistics I've got one for you. What's the most common cause of death for adults over the age of eighteen? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Heart attack. That was easy street. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second most common? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skin cancer. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty third most common. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitbull attacks. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just made that up. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you're gonna check. They both chuckle, Trevor's expression gets serious. Afte moment of silence. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you two happy together?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We startred off to be. She was, I guess I was. I just sort of....butchered up the relationship somehow. (to himself) Bad choice of words. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, I think. Other women? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's like I was a different guy then I am today. I can't remember that guy. I see these women, they think I'm someone else, and I'm not that guy anymore. I'm not sure who Kristy knew. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were unfaithful, it sounds like your confessing. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did more then that. Allison reaches accross the table for Trevors hand. A qui moment. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Com'on.   How bout some fresh air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor and Allison sit in a couple of chairs looking out the other rooftops around them. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky for us these chairs happened to be here. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I knew about the chairs already. This is where the emphysema patients come to sneak cigarettes. She points to the ground at myriad butts scattered at the feet. Trevor smiles and looks at his hands. ALLISON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me. Kirsty used to smoke? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She just would have loved it up here... Allison when I was under... did I ever talk?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure plenty of times. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anything I said that made you stop and wonder, you know, "where did that come from?" ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure plenty of times. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor if someone is talking from a sleep state they are obviously dreaming. So practically everything say is going to sound strange. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ever talk about the accident? ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ever talk about Kirsty? ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But at one point you did repeat something though. A phrase. You must have been having this recurring dream, you just kept saying this one thing over and over TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it? ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said, "Jealousy arouses a husbands fury, and he will show no mercy when he takes revenge." (Proverbs 6:34) Does that mean anything to you Trevor? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means I have alot more questions. Trevor stares off into the distance. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times up for today. I've got to get back.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Allison SMILES and pats Trevor's knee. He melts and puts hand on hers. She slowly takes it away and fixes her hair TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it makes you feel better that took every ounce of self control I had. Trevor, I never date patients. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand... I won't- ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't understand. That's why I've been fighting to get you better. So you wouldn't be a patient anymore. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me sooner? I would have switched doctors! ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get better okay? She caresses his face then looks at her watch. ALLISON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get back to work. And so do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor walks through the maze of cubicles a big smile on face. He's actually having a good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bret's already looking up at Trevor as he ENTERS. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say a word, Bret. Trevor's smile disappears when he sees someone's already sitting in his chair. LANGE. He's on Trevor's computer surfing the internet. BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lange) Guess I'll leave you two alone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concentrating on the computer) Nice chatting with ya. Bret gets up and LEAVES as Trevor approaches Lange. LANGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm in your seat aren't I? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No please make yourself at home. Trevor sits in Bret's chair as Lange logs off and swivels face Trevor. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's everything, Mr. Gooding? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we dispense with the games for once? LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you loved games. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just stay out of this conversation until you come out and tell me why you've disrupted me at work. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and your wife were playing a game shortly before you got into that car accident weren't you? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? Where is my wife? Lange shakes his head and pulls something else out of his pocket. It's The Cube sealed in a ziploc. Trevor cannot conceal a feeling of dread. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found this curious little object not too far from the site of the accident. No prints but forensics scraped a little dark residue that was caked on one of the corners. It was blood Trevor. Matched some blood we took off your car seat too. Can you tell me anything about it?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lange) It looks familiar. I think it was in the car... LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee you think so? Lange puts the cube back in his pocket and stands up. LANGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to take up your time like that Trevor. Don't work too hard. Oh, before I forget. I talked your neighbor out of pressing charges. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whackjob in the black lipstick who lives down the hall? She wanted you arrested for harassment. I told her to chill out and smoke a joint. I'd look the other way as long as she did you know? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all here for you Trevor. Lange gets up and EXITS. Trevor satys seated, after a bea stands up looking over his cubicle and sees DET. GIVENS staring back at him from the door. Trevors sits back down Trevor suddenly clutches his head as if it's been killing this whole time. He goes to his chair picks up the phone dials. RECORDING (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone) We're sorry the number you have has either been disconnected or no longer in service. If you feel you have reached this recording in error- Trevor hangs up. We can almost hear his head throbbing in pain. He turns around and there's BRET LEANING AGAINST his desk eating a frozen yogurt. Staring at Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frogurt guy's here. They're all out chocolate vanilla swirl or I'd have gotten you one. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you would have. Bret nods, tosses the frozen yogurt container out and sit down. BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey if you're not doing anything I'd like to buy you a beer after work. Be just like old times. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the occasion? BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quit. Today's my last day. This hits Trevor like a ton of bricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is practically empty. Bret and Trevor play dart and work on a pitcher of beer. Country Western plays on t jukebox. BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a better offer. More time off. A sort of career shift, more in the engineering line of work. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time off? BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as he feels like. Its a much more pleasurable line of work. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as he likes? BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yahtzee. Were all in this together Trev. Trevor there are people who are doing exactly what we're doing but they don't need to wear a tie, punch a clock or have some tight assed supervisor breathing down their necks. Its all about the pleasure Trevor!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're just packing it up just like that? BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost that fast. I got a few loose ends to tie up first. Came into a shitload of money recently. I've always wanted to go to take a trip. We're just gonna walk into the airport and decide right then and there. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? You and who else? BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone special. Bret throws a dart with extra mph. It misses the board entirely and hits the wall. Trevor winces in pain suddenl He touches his head and looks at his fingers. Fresh blood

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Trevor in the car in the water. Thrashing about, he bleed from his head in the flashback as well. Where's Kristy? H looks in the passenger seat. She's gone. Trevor takes the cube from the man with the ring. He fumb with the puzzle box in the darkness. CU box.   It starts to move. Trevor driving with Kristy, She's going down on him while he's driving. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay pull over. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) But... I thought... Trevor waits a moment to see if she's kidding. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through clenched teeth) PULL OVER NOW. The car comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trevor gets the goods while he watches himself in the rea view mirror. Someone approaches. Trevor zips up, pulls Kristy up out o his lap. Its a cenobite. Trevor screams and opens the door of the car to make a frantic exit. He dive out onto the pavement and looks bac All is quiet. He's alone a quiet road. He stands up and into an eerie world of slow motion . Tre looks up the road and back to find- A beautiful vision of Allison walking toward him. Walking gracefully, she approaches Trevor. Raises her hand to his face. Trevor smiles, then slowly looks back towards the c Inside the car he see's Kristy playing with the puzzle bo Trevors calls out to her. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristy noooo! And he makes a move toward the car, as the box comes to l This stops Trevor in his tracks, and he looks toward Alli Who is now PINHEAD. PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no reprieve for you. Not even in her. She's only a vision I'm afraid. Tervors looks dumbfounded. PINHEAD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth hurts doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor raises his head from the bar. The beers are there Bret is gone. Trevors stares at himself in the mirror opposite the bar. He looks like shit. He thinks hard abou the flashback. Out the door he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Trevor's holding the phone up to his ear agitated beyond belief. He'd pace if he could. Instead he just fumes. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes I'm trying to reach one of your interns... Allison Dormere...? She works in the emergency room there... What do you mean...? I just saw her today... Yes I'm sure she works there I've been in and out of that place five times in the last month...! Well good day to you too asshole! -CLOSE UP on Trevor's hand searching through the D's in t white pages. He slams the book shut in frustration. -He's on the phone again. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No such listing...? Could you at least tell me IF she has an unlisted number...? What do you mean there are no Dormeres at all there have to be...! WELL LOOK AGAIN! (a beat, more timidly) H-hello? Trevor SLAMS the phone down and touches his head again. H looks at his hand. The blood is gone. But the headache is back. Its crippling at this point. He's at his wits end. reaches into his pocket and finds Pages card. Maybe as a resort? THE PHONE RINGS. IT RINGS AGAIN. Trevor presses his palm against his eye. Trevor picks up the phone. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello? WIMPERING VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from phone) Goodbye... TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty? WIMPERING VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miserable sonofabitch! DIAL TONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor is out of breath as he walks up to the last resort The entrance to Sage's building. The front door is locked presses a three digit code on the alarm box. RING. RING. phone picks up. He's deperate. SAGE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sage it's me Trevor. You've got to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor's head hits the pillow on the acupuncture table. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feeling is very distinct. It's like somebody stuck a shard of glass through my eye and it's embedded halfway into my brain. Sage nods, patient look on her face. SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor your body has been completely healed. All the nerve endings have repaired themselves. If there is any pain in your head it's... in your head. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez it's getting awful crowded in there. SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are physically better. It's your soul that still hurts. Sage grabs a bunch of needles from the table. SAGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My teacher told me once there's a puncture point on your body that can lock your soul within it, even after you're dead. So that when you die you're trapped inside your body, watching it corrode for all eternity. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, whatever your Marharagi, told you, forget. You've got to get this fuckin pain to stop.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an analogy. Your soul is locked up inside you. You need to free it Trevor. You've blocked it from the healing process. That's what we need to do now. Heal your soul. And to do that I you have to give in utterly and without any hesitation or doubt. Do you know what I mean by giving in? It's about trust. Do you trust me implicitly? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know what's real and what isn't how can I trust anyone? SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can trust me. Your wife is dead and you need to move past that. And the only way to move past something completely is to go straight through it, not around it. Surrender yourself to your wife's death. Let it chew you up and spit you back out on the other side. It's the only way you can become whole again. Sage looks Trevor dead in the eye. SAGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I surrender... Trevor closes his eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Sage dimming the lights so that the room is nice and dark... placing needles into Trevor's body... his shoulders... his chest... his neck... his legs... his fac Trevor finally opens his eyes to find... ... he's completely naked on Sage's table! And she's maki love to his body, which is now filled with needles! TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... what the hell is this... SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Surrender yourself... surrender yourself...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She holds up a small chunk of ice and begins rubbing it o Trevor's chest. He catches his breath at the cold and beg to shiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor wakes up shivering. He is in the passenger seat, h resting against a baby blanket. A hand touches his... ... Kirsty's. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty... Kirsty? KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay it was just a nightmare that's all. Trevor looks at Kirsty. She is breathtakingly beautiful. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alive... KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Now go back to sleep. You're driving the rest of the way to gramma's remember? Trevor looks in the back and for the first time sees an INFANT GIRL sleeping in a car seat behind him. KIRSTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor I've decided we have got to agree on a name before we reach my mother's. This poor kid's going to be starting preschool as student x if we don't make up our minds. So, I've been thinking, what about Daisy? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the baby) It's perfect. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that was easy all of a sudden. Trevor looks back at Kirsty. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty... I'm glad you're alive.

dialogues.speaker: THE SIREN FROM AN APPROACHING AMBULANCE GETS LOUDER AND
dialogues.text: LOUDER, piercing Trevor's ears.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trevor winces in pain and blocks his ears from the noise. Kirsty looks at him, puzzled. He can only read her lips: "Honey what's wrong? Honey?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor's eye rivet open again. A PARAMEDIC is snapping hi fingers in front of them. Another paramedic is readying a hypodermic. PARAMEDIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me? Just nod. Trevor nods. PARAMEDIC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where you are? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulance. PARAMEDIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just gonna take some blood here. The other paramedic sticks a needle in Trevor's arm. PARAMEDIC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what day it is? Trevor shakes his head. The paramedic holds up two finger PARAMEDIC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay how many fingers am I holding up? TREVOR
