dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two. PARAMEDIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you follow them? Paramedic moves his hand left to right. Trevor keeps his on it. PARAMEDIC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. Hey you remember what happened back there? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean... when the car went off the bridge? PARAMEDIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Wow you are out of it. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PARAMEDIC (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it was nothing that extreme. You were riding on the bus and just collapsed onto the floor. Out cold. Remember being on a bus now? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... maybe... I don't know. PARAMEDIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool. Here we are. The ambulance comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of orderlies wheel Trevor into the exact room he been coming to this whole time. The orderlies EXIT and wh should ENTER but Dr. Ambrose... and the ANGULAR NURSE who readied him for the brain surgery at the beginning. DR. AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello I'm Dr... TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambrose. I know. DR. AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we met? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been in here before. DR. AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take no offense Trevor. I see many patients a day and have an awful memory. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join the club. Ambrose holds a penlight up to each of Trevor's eyes and nods. DR. AMBROSE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Trevor you just had a seizure brought on by a severe migraine. Things could be much worse. In the next few days you need to take plenty of aspirin, stay out of the sun and make sure you've had at least eight glasses of water by the time you go to bed at night. Trevor just stares at Dr. Ambrose.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DR. AMBROSE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you relax for the next couple of hours? Barring any relapses you should be able to go home after that. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Allison? Dr. Ambrose looks a little confused. DR. AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Allison? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison Dormere. Your intern. Ambrose looks at the nurse, who shrugs, then back at Trev DR. AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh we have no intern by that name here Mr. Gooding. Listen I'll be back in a few hours to check up on you meantime relax try not to move around too much. Ambrose pats Trevor's shoulder congenially and WALKS OUT. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There there Trevor. Get some sleep. Trevor tenses when the nurse smiles. NURSE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need anything give myself or any of the nurses a call okay? We're- TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me. Г«We're all here for you Trevor' right? Go ahead say it! You know you want to! The nurse looks taken aback. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about...? Trevor suddenly jumps up yanking electrodes and IV tubes his body. The nurse is back to normal and very disconcert NURSE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor! Mr. Gooding lay back down- Trevor runs out of the woman mowing the woman down in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor rushes down the halls of the hospital nearly knock down Dr. Ambrose. DR. AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Trevor races as fast as his feet can carry him easily los Dr. Ambrose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor runs down a corridor through another doorway and i another wing of the hospital entirely. He arrives at the to Allison's office and throws it open. It's actually a janitor's closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in janitorial garb, Trevor bursts open the stairw door and comes out on the roof. An OLD MAN in a johnnie is sitting in one of the chairs n too far away. An oxygen tube trails from his nose to an oxygen tank at his feet. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wheezing) Okay ya caught me. He brings a cigarette to his lips and takes a long drag. OLD MAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least let me finish will ya? Got one puff left. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't work here. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music to my ears. The old man lights a fresh cigarette with the one he's ju finished. Trevor turns to go back and THERE'S ALLISON standing in t doorway. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor. I heard you were looking for me. Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison! Am I glad to see you! (changing his tone) No... everything's not right. Not at all. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here. Allison holds him. The old smoker turns and watches with curiosity. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison I think I did some very, very bad things. I mean very bad. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor things like this happen to people who experience temporary memory loss. Everybody does things they regret. You just couldn't remember doing these things and now you are so it's a shock to the system. I'm telling you. You will never get better if you keep blaming yourself for your wife's death. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I wasn't responsible for the car accident... The old man calls out to Trevor wheezily. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey buddy! TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) ... but I'm starting to think I was... I was going to... OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey buddy! Trevor turns to the old man. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?! OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wheezing) Who the hell are you talking to? Trevor turns and Allison is gone. Vanished into thin air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor sits at the front of an empty bus rubbing his head stares at the spot where the creepy old lady knitting the baby's bootie used to sit. He looks under the seat. There nothing there. The HYDRAULICS HISS as the bus comes to a stop. BUS DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it mister. Trevor gets up and hurries off giving the driver a cursor glance. The driver doesn't look at Trevor as he speaks. BUS DRIVER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good night now. Trevor EXITS the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor steps out of the bus and faces the ROMAN CATHOLIC CATHEDRAL. He ascends the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor sits in the booth across from the tiny screen, beh which is a VERY TIRED PRIEST who is still in his pajamas. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'm doing here. I'm not even Catholic. I just had to tell somebody. It's like, ever since my wife died I don't know what I've actually done or what I've imagined. But I do know if one tenth of what's happening to me is reality... I've done some really awful things in my life. Things that I've... I guess I've blocked out... PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What things do you think you've done? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Let's see. So many sins so little time. For starters I was responsible for the death my wife who by the way was carrying my unborn child. That was so I could collect her eight million dollar estate. I think I killed several women I was having mindless sex with behind her back. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I did those murders just for the hell of it. Finally... I think I made some kind of deal with the devil and now he's come to collect my soul. Only he's decided to mess with my head first. How many Hail Marys do you recommend for that one father? PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor I'm sure you killed no one. You are very distraught over your wife's death and rightfully so. You did the right thing by confessing to me here tonight. And you should keep praying for the wisdom that will set your soul at ease. That being said, you are still in a highly emotional state right now. It might do you some good to get some professional help. Confess to them the way you confessed to me. In time you'll probably find that the real killer has already been caught. Or better yet... that these murders never happened at all. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I saw these women. I saw their mutilated bodies. I saw their ghosts. I just know it happened I can feel it... PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you've got is the here and the now Trevor. That's all anyone really has. Maybe this will make things easier to understand. A man goes to sleep every night and has recurring dream that he's a butterfly. In time he begins to wonder if he might actually be a butterfly who dreams he's a man. And at the end of the day does it even matter? All these events you're describing. How can you be sure any of them really happened? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's what I need. To be sure... to be absolutely sure... PRIEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. It's okay son. There is but one truth. One thing you can be absolutely sure of. And that thing is this: The priest moves closer to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PRIEST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: WE'RE ALL HERE FOR YOU TREVOR.
dialogues.text: The Priest begins to chuckle ominously. Resisting the urge to scream Trevor bolts out of the confessional...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor rushes out of the confessional. THE CATHEDRAL BELL begins to CLANG. Eardrums getting battered by the RINGING Trevor blocks his ears and rushes toward the exit- -coming face to face with a gargoyle blocking his path. PINHEAD. Though he speaks softly his voice is heard easil over the bell. PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in the dark I see? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Trevor. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This game is over do you hear me? PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear everything. And soon you will know everything. More than you ever wanted I can guarantee that. But I want you to think for a minute first. Think about all you've seen. All the clues you've been given. Pinhead opens his cloak revealing the darkness within. To Trevor's shock his sucked right into this void inside Pinhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor is thrust into the interior of his office building Everyone's gone for the day. The only light is coming in streetlights outside. Trevor races past the cubicles runn out into a hallway. He looks down one end then the other... where he sees an office light is on. He cautiously approaches the office. He looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen's hacked up body is strewn about the office. Her arm are atop the filing cabinet. Legs under her desk. Ass on copier. Trevor hears someone coming. He looks down the hall to se FLASHLIGHT BEAM TURN THE CORNER, blinding him. It's beare begins running toward Trevor. Trevor bolts the other direction heading for the exit. He pushes the door open and slams it behind him only he's no still outside yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tawny lies on the bed, dead, tongue sticking out of her n ribcage violated. Trevor hears someone coming toward the bedroom can see th flashlight beam jittering as its bearer approaches. Trevor rushes toward the window, opens it and leaps out o the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor's about to climb down the fire escape when he is bathed in the flashlight's beam from inside. Trevor looks down and sees a garbage dumpster full of trash bags below jumps. Trevor sails down three stories and lands in the dumpster climbs out and runs to the street as fast as he can. He r down the sidewalk trying to get his bearings at the same time. Hearing footsteps from behind Trevor turns to see: The Stranger in the Window not half a block behind Trevor keeping Trevor's pace. Then... Trevor stops. And turns. The Stranger stops as well. This has never happened befor Trevor shouts down the empty street. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: WHO ARE YOU
dialogues.text: His voice echoes off the darkened buildings. The Stranger stands there. Trevor begins walking toward h blood in his eyes. The Stranger backs away.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trevor bolts into a run and the Stranger takes off runnin the other way. The stranger darts into an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor runs into the alley, seeing no signs of the strang The end of the alley is pitch black. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: WHERE'S MY WIFE
dialogues.text: Trevor hears something at the end of the alley. He grabs broken bottle out of a garbage can and heads toward the darkness. Trevor's teeth are bared now. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: WHERE'S MY WIFE
dialogues.text: Something GLISTENS in the dark just before the razor shar edge of a switchblade touches his left jugular. Trevor freezes. OUT OF THE SHADOWS comes... BRET. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bret... what the fuck...? BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight was supposed to be the night, Trevor. Remember? I couldn't believe you went through five dart games and didn't even joke about it. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bret. What the hell is going on? BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were gonna be millionaires you said. Nobody'd suspect a thing. I had never even met her. No connection. Then you went and had that fucking car accident. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bret you are making no sense whatsoever. BRET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed her Trevor. I got to know her life. And what a boring one it was. Six a.m. gym, nine a.m. trendy coffee shop, noon bookstore, one soap operas, four o'clock news, five wait for Trevor to come home. And wait and wait and wait. Nine o'clock get ready for bed. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRET (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten o'clock fall asleep in front of the TV. She did that every day I followed her. Every single day. While you were out fucking your concubines. Every day I felt more and more bad for her, man. And hated you more and more. Trevor is absolutely speechless. BRET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I find out you're having nooners with my GWEN. That was all I could take. I didn't want to kill your wife anymore. I wanted to kill you. Even before that little accident I decided to do it on the day we'd set aside for her. Bret presses the blade against Trevor's neck a little har drawing a rivulet of blood. BRET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now that ain't gonna happen either. I fell in love with Kirsty Trevor. The day she died it was like my soul had been ripped from my body. Not just because I lost someone I loved. It's because the child inside her... was mine. Bret then puts the knife to his neck. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Bret drags the knife across his own jugulars slicing them open. Blood pours out of his smiling mouth. Then somethin really weird happens. Cuts begin to open up all over Bret face and his hands. Blood pouring to the ground in bucket Bret lifelessly falls into the pool of blood... Before he process what's just happened, Trevor hears a NOISE behind and turns to see... several of those slithering sewer monsters coming toward him, surrounding him. And behind them, SEVERAL SILHOUETTED FIGURES walking slow toward him. We don't need three guesses to figure out who they are... CENOBITES. Panicking Trevor reaches down and grabs the knife out of Bret's hand and readies himself for the inevitable attack when- -the BLINDING LIGHT FROM A POLICE car illuminates the all First Trevor notices the sewer monsters are gone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then the figures we thought were Cenobites are actually L and several police officers. Lange looks disappointed. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Trevor. Put the knife down. Trevor does so. TWO COPS rush up to Trevor and one swings baton down just over Trevor's eye- CRACK! LIGHTS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor's nose has been bleeding. His eye is black and blu his lip cut. Trevor looks out the window. The streets are deserted, foreign. Trevor looks at the rear view mirror. The cop staring bac him averts his gaze. Trevor thinks he sees something craw into the cop's eye. Lange sits next to the cop, staring back at Trevor. He ta out his antihistamine and sprays some up his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors burst open and the two cops, Lange escorts Trev IN. The lobby is entirely deserted. Trevor looks around. Ther are cups of coffee sitting on desks, jackets thrown over backs of chairs. Signs of a recently bustling workplace t has vacated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops hustle Trevor up to a counter, finger print him, him in a chair. One of them sits at a computer terminal. Despite being indoors both cops keep their sunglasses on. COP#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full name? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor Alan Gooding. COP#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Age? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty one. (beat) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TREVOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you guys ever take your sunglasses off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops hurry Trevor down a dank corridor toward a line room. Trevor sneaks a peek inside one of the rooms. INSIDE THE DOORWAY: TWO DETECTIVES have some HAPLESS SOUL strapped to some odd looking electrical contraption. HAPLESS SOUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I don't know! DETECTIVE#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong answer! Detective#1 hits a button and a shock races through the Hapless Soul's body. Just then the other detective notice Trevor looking in and SLAMS the door shut. The trio comes to the line up room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor is shoved into the cramped booth-like room with fo other strange looking MEN who all stare at him. Silence f moment then: A LOUD BUZZ is heard and the door on the other side of ro opens. COP#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Single file. Trevor follows the other men. The MAN just ahead of Trevo turns to him. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all here for you Trevor. COP#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor walks IN with the rest of the gentlemen. Hugging t nearest wall they go up a small set of stairs onto a stag Trevor hears Lange's VOICE overhead. LANGE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop and face the mirror!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The five men do as they're told, facing a large two-way mirror on the opposite wall. An awkward moment. LANGE'S VOICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! The door to the room opens again and Trevor turns, leadin the other men back through the anteroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops hustle Trevor out into the hallway. The next doo down opens and out come two more detectives and... TAWNY' BOYFRIEND, the brute, looking fit to be tied. He sees Tre and fills with rage. BRUTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope they fry your ass mutherfucker! He lunges at Trevor. It takes the detectives he's with an two more cops to keep him from pummeling Trevor. As Trevo lead away the brute begins to sob uncontrollably. BRUTE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Trevor)

dialogues.speaker: YOU'RE GONNA BURN IN HELL
dialogues.text: COP#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got quite a fan club don't you, hotshot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor sits at a tape recorder. Lange sits across from hi TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the last time. I honestly don't know how any of them died... Lange stands, squirting antihistamine in his nose. He nod Trevor and WALKS OUT. No sooner has the door closed when opens again and Givens walks IN. Givens gets right in Trevor's face. GIVENS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I want you to tell me what you remember happening- in your own words- exactly the way you told Detective Lange. But this time I want you to make one small adjustment. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Givens whirls around revealing Lange's face on the back o his head! LANGE

dialogues.speaker: DON'T FUCKING LIE TO ME
dialogues.text: Trevor thinks a moment. He is absolutely numb. He smiles little insanely. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it. I killed them all. I confess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still handcuffed Trevor is escorted toward the detention by the cops in the sunglasses. He's silently praying he'l wake up from this one somehow. No such luck. Trevor and t cops round a corner and there's Lange running up to them. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the cops) Quick detour through the morgue boys. Lange leads them to a set of elevators. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgue...? LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right Trevor. The timing was impeccable wasn't it? It's been eight months two weeks and three days but we finally found the body. Just need you to ID it for us. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was it? LANGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the weird part. It just magically turned up in the river less than thirty yards from where the car had landed. Like somebody put it there while we weren't looking. The elevator doors open and they get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long ride down. Nobody speaks. Trevor looks at the cops in the sunglasses. One of them t his pair off. His eye sockets are empty. We can see brain

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The cop cleans his shades then his mouth smiles at Trevor before he puts the sunglasses back on. Finally the doors open. Lange unlocks Trevor's handcuffs the cops push him out the door into a dark corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor looks back to see Lange and the cops staring back him. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep walking Trevor. You can't miss it. One of the cops waves bye-bye to him. And with that the elevator doors shut. Trevor turns around and faces the long corridor. He begin his hike towards its end where an ominous set of double d awaits. He arrives at them and pushes them open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as the doors open fluorescent lights flicker over illuminating two walls of metal drawers and between them: large slab of marble upon which rests a human form covere with a sheet. Trevor ENTERS. He makes his way toward the body and stares at it. A low WHEEZING noise coming from a dark corner just beyon the slab distracts him. Trevor looks and freezes when he sees: THE GOAT laying on the floor in a pool of blood. It's sti breathing. One of the goat's slatted eyes is staring at Trevor as if begging for mercy. A STRANGE RIPPING NOISE i heard. The goat MEWLS in pain then its eye rolls up. Dead The animal's body begins to quiver as a tiny wound on its back widens spitting out streams of blood. Trevor begins to back away as the wound stretches open, giving birth to a rising form... PINHEAD. He rises completely from the goat, stepping out the wound. He is red with blood for a second. Then his sk and robe absorb the blood like a sponge. Pinhead approach Trevor blocking him from the body on the slab.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is our little student doing? Has he learned his lesson yet? TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who you are or what you want. I just want to know what's under that sheet... PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use your mind for something other than numbers dear Trevor. Think about people for a change. People other than yourself. Like the women you slept with behind your wife's back. You were always so confident you had covered your tracks. Always confident your wife actually believed your fervent denials? Part of you must have known she would find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen has Trevor on her desk riding him like a hobby horse Rain pounds against her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty sits inside the car looking up at the window, eyes narrowing. PINHEAD (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jealousy arouses a spouse's fury. And no mercy will be shown when that revenge is given.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubbing the baby that's growing inside her, Kirsty sits i front of the TV watching Trevor having yet another romant rendezvous with TAWNY. THE TV SCREEN DISSOLVES to Trevor in bed with yet another woman... and another... and another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fatal BELL begins to TOLL. With each peel the walls the morgue shakes. It's walls begin to rumble and crack.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even a mind as narcissistic as yours must have wondered: What unspeakable acts was your wife committing behind YOUR back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE UP AT: Kirsty, Trevor's lovely wife, raising a above her. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to camera) Goodbye you miserable sonofabitch! And SLAMMING a rock down on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's under that sheet...? PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably don't remember the night we played. Your first year as husband and wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor and a very pregnant Kirsty sit on their bed, passi the cube back and forth. Trevor's the one with the magic touch. The cube begins to open in his hands. Kirsty's eye light up as she watches... PINHEAD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must have seemed like we were uninvited guests crashing your little celebration. ON the walls as shadows begin to flail in pain and panic. SCREEN SCREAMS are heard as blood begins to shower the wa of the bedroom. PINHEAD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But someone was expecting us Trevor. And everything went according to plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were about to come for Kirsty. When we were offered a deal. We don't usually consider bargains but this one was too good to pass up. A tribute to the resourcefulness of a parent hellbent on protecting its spawn. The deal we were offered was this: three more souls in exchange for the life of the unborn child inside Kirsty. The three souls had already been picked out. Needless to say we were very impressed. The lights dim. Drawers behind Pinhead begin to open. We Gwen's body, Tawny's, Sage's, Bonnie's. PINHEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of your favorite companions, most supple and delicious as you already know. And the man you had at one time conspired to kill Kirsty with. Until you found out she was with child. QUICK IMAGES of Gwen, Tawny, and Bret being rent to piece the Cenobites, SCREAMING in vain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINHEAD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were all real screamers too. We had a blast. And there was one more. You've seen many things you wished you hadn't. Many nightmares from which you never awoke. They were all clues in our little puzzle. Can you guess now Trevor? Can you guess the fifth soul chosen for us to torment in this little agreement? The lights flicker overhead, reddening with each strobe. Hundreds of those little sewer monsters come slithering o of the cracks in the walls, racing toward Trevor. He does care. TREVOR

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PINHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Welcome to the worst nightmare of them all, Trevor. Reality. Pinhead grabs the sheet and whips it back. Trevor's jaw drops in disbelief. IT'S TREVOR'S BODY. It is blue, bloated and mutilated. Th corpse's skull has a massive crack in it. TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty sits across from Lange, who slides the cube across desk towards her. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open this and your problem will disappear forever. And no one will ever suspect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty drives. Trevor sits in the passenger seat, in the position we saw him in during his last flashback. Only no is clear the reason his head is resting on the baby blank is to keep his brains from spilling out his split open sk ON KIRSTY'S HAND holding his. It is now covered with bloo KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car goes off the bridge landing in the water. Kirsty' head breaks the surface. She watches the car sink into th river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor stares at his own dead body in utter disbelief. Th sewer monsters begin crawling up his legs. Pinhead smiles TREVOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The scream ECHOES over Trevor's dead self, which seems so tranquil in contrast. HOLD on the corpse. After a beat th bells stop, as does the rumbling and the cracking. The li brighten. Serenity. Then: KIRSTY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes that's him. REVERSE ANGLE on Kirsty looking down at the corpse wiping eyes. She looks over to the other side of the body where Trevor and Pinhead had been standing. Where now DETECTIVE LANGE and the coroner DR. AMBROSE had been standing. The two gentlemen look at each other. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I guess that's it then. Thank you Mrs. Gooding I realize that must have been tough. Lange escorts Kirsty to the door. They EXIT but not befor Kirsty gives her late husband a parting glance. Ambrose covers Trevor's body and looks OFF CAMERA. DR. AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alrighty. Let's get started folks. REVERSE on two other DOCTORS who are busying themselves collecting instrument. ALLISON and SAGE. They walk over t Trevor's body and get to work. Sage sticks a needle in Trevor's arm. SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collecting 40ccs of serum... AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Examining cranial fracture... Allison at his side, Ambrose checks the wound on Trevor's head, pauses to look inside Trevor's eyes. TREVOR'S POV: Ambrose closing the eyelid again. AMBROSE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking oral cavity for blockage... Ambrose opens Trevor's mouth. AMBROSE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we have a winner... Ambrose pulls a long black dead lamprey out of Trevor's mouth. Looks at the slippery creature for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like an eel of some kind. AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it was murder after all. SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah all we need is the eel's motive. Allison holds out a large freezer bag, into which Ambrose dumps the dead lamprey. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't get it. He's been missing for almost eight months. But this body hasn't been dead more than twenty four hours. DR. AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes you wonder what he was up to between the time he disappeared and when he died. Allison walks right up to the corpse's face. ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? What do you say Trevor? Que pasa? DR. AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shivering) Allison what on earth possesses you to converse with cadavers? SAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Trevor's corpse) It's simple, Dr. Ambrose. What if there is no afterlife? What happens when we die? Do we just stay stuck inside your bodies for eternity watching ourselves decompose? AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not following this... ALLISON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if that's the case... wouldn't you want someone to talk to you like a normal human being one last time? AMBROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are creeping me out. And I'm a coroner.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Allison fixes a stray lock of hair on Trevor's forehead. QUICK CUTS: Allison slipping a tag on Trevor's toe; slidi Trevor's body into the morgue drawer; her hand turning th lock on the drawer. ALLISON (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adios amigo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lange sits across from Kirsty, who signs some paperwork o Lange's desk. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have come in sooner but I had an important errand to run last night. Out of town. Figures you'd find his body the minute I decide to go off somewhere. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you made it down here that's the important part. Thank you for your patience Mrs. Gooding. She nods teary eyed. She slides the paperwork across his and gets up to leave. LANGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last thing... When they found him he was holding something. Not to get too graphic but they had to wrench it from his hand. Lange reaches under his desk then stands revealing: THE CUBE inside a ziploc bag. Lange and Kirsty exchange a knowing glance. LANGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured you might want it. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. That was my... last anniversary present to him. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A token to remember him by now. Goodbye Mrs. Gooding. She takes the cube.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you detective. Lange takes out his nasal sprayer as she walks OUT. She closes the door behind her and Lange looks up at the clos door. He sticks the sprayer up his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty walks toward the exit. On her way she passes a tra can. She discretely tosses the cube into it and rubs her hands together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The birds are chirping. The sun is shining. Kirsty Goodin walks out the door and takes a breath of fresh air. She s down the steps of the police station toward the street. S stops in the middle of the sidewalk looking both ways. A SHADOW COMES up behind her. It's the STRANGER Trevor ha seen out his window. He grabs her shoulder startling Kirs She turns to see LARRY ELLIS, shit-eating grin on his fac He's holding an eight month old BABY. The one he was draw LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for someone, Kirsty? KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the baby) You bet I was. Kirsty plants a multitude of smothering kisses on the laughing child as A NANNY comes up behind Larry pushing a stroller. Kirsty gently places the baby in it. KIRSTY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nanny) Okay we're on our way. Remember her- NANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lactose intolerance. I've stocked the fridge with Lactaid. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you in a couple of weeks. You've got my cell number right? The Nanny pushes the stroller away, nodding, waving good- Larry smiles as he watches the baby go.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy is getting so big. (beat) I still can't believe HE was her father. Kirsty smiles to herself. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counselor can we not mention HIM anymore. Can we just start spending HIS money instead. They walk slowly toward the curb. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to go to Madagascar. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the place with bats? LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're called flying lemurs. KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah that sounds like a real blast... They put their arms around each other. KIRSTY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about it. This has to have been the best eight months of my life. Larry sees a cab and rushes out to hail it. LARRY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: TAXI
dialogues.text: Something out the corner of her eye scares Kirsty. She tu to see Lange standing there. LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot something. Lange holds up the cube she tossed out. Kirsty's expressi falls. But... how...? KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Thank you. Kirsty takes the cube.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LANGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Mrs. Gooding. Lange turns and Kirsty's shock there's Givens' face... on back of Lange's head! GIVENS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank YOU. Givens smiles at her then walks away. She slowly walks to the cab where Larry has opened the door for her. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you my dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsty slides into the cab looking at the cube in despair Larry slides in after her. LARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the cabbie) Airport please. He grabs Kirsty's knee. She just stares at the cube. LARRY (CONT'D) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up? Larry looks down at the cube. It has magically risen from palms and begun to rearrange itself in that way we've com know and love so well. The cabbie, looking back at the sight, slowly slides the window between the driver and passenger compartments shut KIRSTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time, Larry. Time's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cab drives off into traffic we see LIGHT FLICKER f within it. The cab passes a cathedral. Its BELL BEGINS TO TOLL.
